author: William Baldwin
title: Best ETFs: Diversified International Funds
text:
You’re supposed to put some of your equity money in overseas companies. At least, that’s what most of the experts will tell you. You can get that foreign exposure very cheaply from the funds at the top of this list.With a $57 cost over ten years on a $10,000 investment, Vanguard FTSE Developed Markets ( VEA ) is the winner in efficiency. That’s not much more than you’d pay to own its mainstream U.S. stock fund ( Total Stock Market , VTI ).Second on our list, Vanguard Total International Stock ( VXUS ), differs from VEA by including emerging markets. Schwab International Equity ( SCHF ) is another respectable choice. It falls lower on the cost ranking, despite an attractive expense ratio, because of other cost factors (bid/ask spreads and the offset from securities lending).Not all investors are attentive to cost comparisons. The biggest foreign-stock fund is iShares MSCI EAFE ( EFA ), with $60 billion, notwithstanding that it costs nine times as much as VEA.Rules for the Best ETFs scorecard, and links to 13 categories of funds, can be found here .
